Calculate summary values for 'Z' elevation attributes

Source: R/z.R
slope_z_value.Rd

The slope_z*() functions calculate summary values for the Z axis in sfc objects with XYZ geometries.

slope_z_value(x)

slope_z_start(x)

slope_z_end(x)

Arguments

x

An sfc object with 'XYZ' coordinates

Examples

x = slopes::lisbon_route_3d
sf::st_geometry(x)

#> Geometry set for 1 feature 
#> geometry type:  LINESTRING
#> dimension:      XYZ
#> bbox:           xmin: -88214.27 ymin: -106127.1 xmax: -86881.07 ymax: -105506.3
#> z_range:        zmin: 6.650858 zmax: 94.99939
#> projected CRS:  ETRS89 / Portugal TM06
#> LINESTRING Z (-88202.31 -105757.6 55.91552, -88...
slope_z_value(x)[1:5]

#> [1] 55.91552 55.52176 54.62495 50.82914 50.76749
xy = slopes::lisbon_route
# slope_z_value(xy) # error message
slope_z_start(x)

#> [1] 55.91552
slope_z_end(x)

#> [1] 94.28048
